title: Skyrim 3-Book Hardcover Collection Is Only $44 At Amazon For Prime Day
description: The Skyrim Library: Volumes 1-3 Box Set (Hardcover) $44.79 with coupon (was $110) See at Amazon The world of Skyrim felt alive when players first ventured into it, and a mountain of discoverable texts helped add to its immersion. Normally, you'd have to travel all over the province to find every piece of parchment, but if you don't have that much time to do so, then you can sit back with The Skyrim Library Box Set for some quality reading. This compiles all of the collected texts into a trio beautifully illustrated hardcover books. The Skyrim Library is available at Amazon for a dragon-sized discount right now.As part of Amazon's early Prime Day 2025 book sale, Elder Scrolls fans can get this $110 collection for only $44.79. Just make sure to click the $12 coupon below the price on Amazon's store page to get the full discount at checkout. The Skyrim Library: Volumes 1-3 Box Set (Hardcover) $44.79 with coupon (was $110) Released back in 2017, this is a collection of three hardcover books with every piece of text from the game. The lore and historical texts are enhanced by beautiful illustrations, so if you ever wanted to have the full story on the game's factions, landscapes, and creatures, then this is a must-have for a Skyrim fan.The other nice thing about this collection is the presentation, as the slipcase cover is designed to mimic one of the dusty old books found in a forgotten corner of Skyrim. It has a foldout cover with a giant mural of Alduin, the ferocious dragon who serves as the main villain in the game. excerpt: As part of its early Prime Day book sale, Amazon is offering The Elder Scrolls: Skyrim Library for cheap.

html:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

The world of Skyrim felt alive when players first ventured into it, and a mountain of discoverable texts helped add to its immersion. Normally, you'd have to travel all over the province to find every piece of parchment, but if you don't have that much time to do so, then you can sit back with The Skyrim Library Box Set for some quality reading. This compiles all of the collected texts into a trio beautifully illustrated hardcover books. The Skyrim Library is available at Amazon for a dragon-sized discount right now.

As part of Amazon's early Prime Day 2025 book sale, Elder Scrolls fans can get this $110 collection for only $44.79. Just make sure to click the $12 coupon below the price on Amazon's store page to get the full discount at checkout.

The Skyrim Library: Volumes 1-3 Box Set (Hardcover)

$44.79 with coupon (was $110)

Released back in 2017, this is a collection of three hardcover books with every piece of text from the game. The lore and historical texts are enhanced by beautiful illustrations, so if you ever wanted to have the full story on the game's factions, landscapes, and creatures, then this is a must-have for a Skyrim fan.

The other nice thing about this collection is the presentation, as the slipcase cover is designed to mimic one of the dusty old books found in a forgotten corner of Skyrim. It has a foldout cover with a giant mural of Alduin, the ferocious dragon who serves as the main villain in the game.

More Elder Scrolls Book Deals

  • The Elder Scrolls: The Official Survival Guide to Tamriel -- $22 ($40)
  • The Elder Scrolls Online: Tales of Tamriel - Volumes 1 and 2 -- $54 ($70)
  • The Elder Scrolls: The Official Cookbook Vol. 2 -- $19 ($35)
  • The Infernal City: An Elder Scrolls Novel -- $11.29 ($19)
  • Lord of Souls: An Elder Scrolls Novel -- $16.44 ($19) | B2G1 Free

To add to your Elder Scrolls collection, you can also grab a few more books inspired by the games. Lord of Souls, an official novel that takes place after the events of The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion, is eligible for Amazon's Buy 2, Get 1 Free Book Sale this week. Unfortunately, Lord of Souls is the second book in a duology, but you can get the first book, The Infernal City, for only $11.29 (was $19).

Elder Scrolls Online players should check out The Official Survival Guide to Tamriel for tips on how to avoid becoming dinner for a dragon. This deluxe hardcover book was only released last year and its full of handy tips and tricks for surviving perilous encounters in that land.

Lore fans can also read up on The Elder Scrolls Online, as this two-book collection offers a collection of in-game texts and exclusive artwork to pore over. When you're not reading them, these are also good-looking books to display thanks to their intricately detailed covers.

Anyone with a hunger for adventure can also check out a new volume of the official Elder Scrolls Cookbook Vol. 2.. This tome contains dozens of recipes--ranging from Troll Fat Jerky to West Weald Corn Chowder--and like other gaming-themed cookbooks, each recipe is accompanied by detailed instructions and photography to help guide you on the way toward making some Fus-Ro-Dinner.

Back to Skyrim: If you'd like to construct a display model featuring the game's terrifying dragon antagonist Alduin the World Eater, the officially licensed 619-piece Skyrim Mega Bloks set is on sale for 15% off at Amazon.
